				[1054] link 'Gitter', url='https://gitter.im/js-stack-from-scratch/'

			[1056] paragraph ''
				[1057] link 'React', url='https://facebook.github.io/react/'
					[1058] image 'React', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/verekia/js-stack-from-scratch/-/raw/master/img/react-padded-90.png'

					[1060] image 'Redux', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/verekia/js-stack-from-scratch/-/raw/master/img/redux-padded-90.png'
				StaticText ''
				[1061] link 'React Router', url='https://github.com/ReactTraining/react-router'
					[1062] image 'React Router', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/verekia/js-stack-from-scratch/-/raw/master/img/react-router-padded-90.png'
				StaticText ''

					[1064] image 'Flow', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/verekia/js-stack-from-scratch/-/raw/master/img/flow-padded-90.png'
				StaticText ''
				[1065] link 'ESLint', url='http://eslint.org/'
					[1066] image 'ESLint', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/verekia/js-stack-from-scratch/-/raw/master/img/eslint-padded-90.png'
				StaticText ''
				[1067] link 'Jest', url='https://facebook.github.io/jest/'
					[1068] image 'Jest', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/verekia/js-stack-from-scratch/-/raw/master/img/jest-padded-90.png'
				StaticText ''
				[1069] link 'Yarn', url='https://yarnpkg.com/'
					[1070] image 'Yarn', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/verekia/js-stack-from-scratch/-/raw/master/img/yarn-padded-90.png'
				StaticText ''
				[1071] link 'Webpack', url='https://webpack.github.io/'
					[1072] image 'Webpack', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/verekia/js-stack-from-scratch/-/raw/master/img/webpack-padded-90.png'
			[1073] paragraph ''
				StaticText 'Welcome to my modern JavaScript stack tutorial:'
				[1074] strong ''
					StaticText 'JavaScript Stack from Scratch'
				StaticText '.'
			[1075] blockquote ''
				[1076] paragraph ''
					StaticText 'üéâ'
					StaticText ''
					[1077] strong ''
						StaticText 'This is the V2 of the tutorial, major changes happened since the 2016 release. Check the'
						[1078] link 'Change Log', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/verekia/js-stack-from-scratch/-/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md'
						StaticText '!'
			[1079] paragraph ''
				StaticText 'This is a straight-to-the-point guide to assembling a JavaScript stack. It requires some general programming knowledge, and JavaScript basics.'
				[1080] strong ''
					StaticText 'It focuses on wiring tools together'
				StaticText 'and giving you the'
				[1081] strong ''
					StaticText 'simplest possible example'
				StaticText 'for each tool. You can see this tutorial as'
				[1082] emphasis ''
					StaticText 'a way to write your own boilerplate from scratch'
				StaticText '. Since the goal of this tutorial is to assemble various tools, I do not go into details about how these tools work individually. Refer to their documentation or find other tutorials if you want to acquire deeper knowledge in them.'
			[1083] paragraph ''
				StaticText "You don't need to use this entire stack if you build a simple web page with a few JS interactions of course (a combination of Browserify/Webpack + Babel + jQuery is enough to be able to write ES6 code in different files), but if you want to build a web app that scales, and need help setting things up, this tutorial will work great for you."
			[1084] paragraph ''
				StaticText 'A big chunk of the stack described in this tutorial uses React. If you are beginning and just want to learn React,'
				[1085] link 'create-react-app', url='https://github.com/facebookincubator/create-react-app'
				StaticText "will get you up and running with a React environment very quickly with a pre-made configuration. I would for instance recommend this approach to someone who arrives in a team that's using React and needs to catch up with a learning playground. In this tutorial you won't use a pre-made configuration, because I want you to understand everything that's happening under the hood."
			[1086] paragraph ''
				StaticText 'Code examples are available for each chapter, and you can run them all with'
				[1087] code ''
					StaticText 'yarn && yarn start'
				StaticText '. I recommend writing everything from scratch yourself by following the'
				[1088] strong ''
					StaticText 'step-by-step instructions'
				StaticText 'though.'
			[1089] paragraph ''
				StaticText 'Final code available in the'
				[1090] link 'JS-Stack-Boilerplate repository', url='https://github.com/verekia/js-stack-boilerplate'
				StaticText ', and in the'
				[1091] link 'releases', url='https://github.com/verekia/js-stack-from-scratch/releases'
				StaticText '. There is a'
				[1092] link 'live demo', url='https://js-stack.herokuapp.com/'
				StaticText 'too.'
			[1093] paragraph ''
				StaticText 'Works on Linux, macOS, and Windows.'
			[1094] blockquote ''
				[1095] paragraph ''
					[1096] strong ''
						StaticText 'Note'
					StaticText ': Since the tutorial was last edited in May 2017, a few libraries have slightly changed their APIs. 95% of the tutorial is still perfectly valid, but if you run into something weird, make sure to check out the'
					[1097] link 'open issues', url='https://github.com/verekia/js-stack-from-scratch/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3Abug'
					StaticText '.'
